caption: Task Instructions
text:
You will evaluate pairs of statements attributed to public figures. For each pair, you must choose the statement you judge to be more truthful, then answer a few questions about each statement.

  1. Select exactly one statement per pair: Read statements A and B and click the card of the one you consider more truthful.
  2. Rate both statements separately:
    • Truthfulness (1â€“10): 1 = definitely false; 10 = definitely true.
    • Agreement: choose your level of agreement from the provided options.

Please base your judgments only on the content shown here (no external sources). A countdown may limit the time available for each item.

Data are collected for research purposes. No personally identifying information is stored. Participation is voluntary and you may stop at any time.

caption: Task Description
text:
You will first complete a brief questionnaire to help us ensure data quality. Then you will evaluate 5 pairs of statements (10 statements total), shown two at a time.

  • Each statement is reported verbatim from its original source.
  • The order is not meaningful; you may encounter any mix of stronger or weaker statements.
  • You can revise earlier answers while navigating, until you finish.
  • You must complete all required fields to move to the next step.
  • Please avoid guessing or random clicks; quality checks may be applied.
